pages.text: One of the most convenient ways to generate power is with air currents through a windmill. $(br2)As long as I am outside in the $(thing)Overworld$(), there's always a surplus of wind energy I can utilize to power my machines.$(br2)A single windmill is likely more than powerful enough to run all of my machines, if I can set up my axle network efficiently.

The standard windmill. $(br2)I need to take care that I don't try to take power from the windmill while it is raining or storming, as the higher wind speeds may cause the connected $(l:innovation/mechpower/gearbox)gearboxes$() to break. A simple lever on the first gearbox of the chain, manually actuated during a storm, would solve this...or a wind chime could also do the trick.
A vertical windmill variation. It is possible to use this type underground, which will prove useful in the depths of the Overworld, or in the Nether.
This bamboo chime sends out a Redstone signal in rain or stormy conditions.
